title: 刘遵峰课题组 | ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室
content: 刘遵峰课题组 | ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室 首页实验室概况实验室简介组织结构学术委员会教授委员会新闻动态实验室新闻实验室动态行业动态研究团队人员概况师资队伍科研团队科技创新科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文学术交流交流与合作举办学术会议学术活动通知仪器平台实验室大型仪器学校仪器平台开放基金开放基金开放基金项目运行管理工作年报运行管理办法评估规则实验室规章制度文件下载  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文刘遵峰课题组 | ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/20   浏览次数：  次Customizable Twisted Nanofluidic Cellulose Fibers by Asymmetric Microfluidics for Self-Powered Urine MonitoringByLin, ZW (Lin, Zewan) [1] ; Fu, XT (Fu, Xiaotong) [1] ; Yang, TT (Yang, Tingting) [1] ; Jiao, CL (Jiao, Chenlu) [1] ; Zheng, K (Zheng, Ke) [1] ; Feng, QC (Feng, Qichun) [1] ; Zhu, SZ (Zhu, Shuze) [2] ; Zhou, X (Zhou, Xiang) [3] ; Liu, ZF (Liu, Zunfeng) [4] ; Ye, DD (Ye, Dongdong) [1]SourceADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1002/adfm.202414365Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-13Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractThe unique selective ion-transport characteristics of nanofluids make them applicable in energy harvesting and sensing. However, developing scalable, self-powered nanofluidic devices remains challenging due to high cost, processing complexity, and reliance on external power sources. In this work, surface-twisted, internally aligned algae fibers (twisted fibers) are fabricated using an asymmetric flow field to regulate the assembly process of the algae cellulose nanofibers. Unlike aligned fibers from the symmetrical process, asymmetric flow-mediated twisted fibers exhibit a significantly reduced diameter (33.6-20.4 mu m), increased packing density (0.87-1.47 g cm-3), superior fractured stress (249.4-468.5 MPa), and an enhanced Herman's orientation parameter (from 0.77 to 0.89). Importantly, twisted fibers demonstrate energy-harvesting up to 12.87 W m-2 under a 50-fold salinity gradient and can serve as self-powered urine monitors, effectively distinguishing infants' urination from motility behaviors and alerting urine saturation due to high ionic conductivity (7.8 mS cm-1) at dilute electrolyte concentrations. This study provides a novel design concept for a self-powered biomass-based nanofluidic health sensing system.上一篇：陈永胜课题组 |  RUSSIAN CHEMICAL BULLETIN下一篇：郭术涛课题组 |  CURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGYCopyright 功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室  版权所有 天津市卫津路94号 　　　--相关链接--中华人民共和国教育部                    中华人民共和国科学技术部                    国家自然科学基金委员会                    ————————                    天津市科学技术委员会                    天津市自然科学基金                    ————————                    南开大学                    南开大学科学技术处                    南开大学化学学院                    刘遵峰课题组 | ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS-南大功能高分子材料教育部重点实验室 首页实验室概况实验室简介组织结构学术委员会教授委员会新闻动态实验室新闻实验室动态行业动态研究团队人员概况师资队伍科研团队科技创新科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文学术交流交流与合作举办学术会议学术活动通知仪器平台实验室大型仪器学校仪器平台开放基金开放基金开放基金项目运行管理工作年报运行管理办法评估规则实验室规章制度文件下载  新闻动态科研课题自主创新科研论文成果奖励近期发表论文  近期发表论文当前位置：首页     > 科技创新     > 近期发表论文     >         正文刘遵峰课题组 | ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/20   浏览次数：  次Customizable Twisted Nanofluidic Cellulose Fibers by Asymmetric Microfluidics for Self-Powered Urine MonitoringByLin, ZW (Lin, Zewan) [1] ; Fu, XT (Fu, Xiaotong) [1] ; Yang, TT (Yang, Tingting) [1] ; Jiao, CL (Jiao, Chenlu) [1] ; Zheng, K (Zheng, Ke) [1] ; Feng, QC (Feng, Qichun) [1] ; Zhu, SZ (Zhu, Shuze) [2] ; Zhou, X (Zhou, Xiang) [3] ; Liu, ZF (Liu, Zunfeng) [4] ; Ye, DD (Ye, Dongdong) [1]SourceADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1002/adfm.202414365Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-13Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractThe unique selective ion-transport characteristics of nanofluids make them applicable in energy harvesting and sensing. However, developing scalable, self-powered nanofluidic devices remains challenging due to high cost, processing complexity, and reliance on external power sources. In this work, surface-twisted, internally aligned algae fibers (twisted fibers) are fabricated using an asymmetric flow field to regulate the assembly process of the algae cellulose nanofibers. Unlike aligned fibers from the symmetrical process, asymmetric flow-mediated twisted fibers exhibit a significantly reduced diameter (33.6-20.4 mu m), increased packing density (0.87-1.47 g cm-3), superior fractured stress (249.4-468.5 MPa), and an enhanced Herman's orientation parameter (from 0.77 to 0.89). Importantly, twisted fibers demonstrate energy-harvesting up to 12.87 W m-2 under a 50-fold salinity gradient and can serve as self-powered urine monitors, effectively distinguishing infants' urination from motility behaviors and alerting urine saturation due to high ionic conductivity (7.8 mS cm-1) at dilute electrolyte concentrations. This study provides a novel design concept for a self-powered biomass-based nanofluidic health sensing system.上一篇：陈永胜课题组 |  RUSSIAN CHEMICAL BULLETIN下一篇：郭术涛课题组 |  CURRENT OPINION IN CHEMICAL BIOLOGY刘遵峰课题组 | ADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS发布人：    发布时间：2024/12/20   浏览次数：  次Customizable Twisted Nanofluidic Cellulose Fibers by Asymmetric Microfluidics for Self-Powered Urine MonitoringByLin, ZW (Lin, Zewan) [1] ; Fu, XT (Fu, Xiaotong) [1] ; Yang, TT (Yang, Tingting) [1] ; Jiao, CL (Jiao, Chenlu) [1] ; Zheng, K (Zheng, Ke) [1] ; Feng, QC (Feng, Qichun) [1] ; Zhu, SZ (Zhu, Shuze) [2] ; Zhou, X (Zhou, Xiang) [3] ; Liu, ZF (Liu, Zunfeng) [4] ; Ye, DD (Ye, Dongdong) [1]SourceADVANCED FUNCTIONAL MATERIALS        arrow_drop_down       DOI10.1002/adfm.202414365Early AccessDEC 2024Indexed2024-12-13Document TypeArticle; Early AccessJump to    arrow_downward   Enriched Cited ReferencesAbstractThe unique selective ion-transport characteristics of nanofluids make them applicable in energy harvesting and sensing.
